edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgnmntFINAL

Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgnmntFINAL.Enemy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Enemy
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Enemy is the threat of the game. A player will mover throughout a grid like enviroment, in hopes of searching for a document, however, the enemy is intended to prevent the player from reach his/her goals. The enemy is to move randomly in the grid, and search each adjacent tile for the player. If the player is next to the enemy, the enemy will stab the player, killing him/her, and sending him/her back to the starting point.
    Author:
    Mario Garcia, Anuja Joshi, Michelle Duoung, Matthew Musquiz, Kristin Adachi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        the serial version UID that will be used in order to properly load a saved game.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • row

        private int row
        the coordinates of the enemy object within the grid. These coordinates are intended to be used for movement along the grid, as well as to assist the enemy in looking for the spy.

      • col

        private int col
        the coordinates of the enemy object within the grid. These coordinates are intended to be used for movement along the grid, as well as to assist the enemy in looking for the spy.

      • alive

        private boolean alive
        boolean value that determines whether the enemy is alive or dead. If alive, then the enemy will still be displayed onto the grid. If not, the enemy object is no longer used in the grid.

      • hidden

        private boolean hidden
        variable that is used to determine whether the enemy object is hidden from sight of the player.

      • symbol

        private java.lang.String symbol
        Symbol used to represent the enemy within the grid. This is only seen if the enemy is visible to the player or the debug method is active.

      • iskilled

        public boolean iskilled()
        sets the alive boolean false for the enemy object.
        Returns:
        alive - returns the state of the enemy. By this, the enemy is killed, and the method is to make the enemy alive boolean false.

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Gives the current state of the enemy whether the object is alive or dead.
        Returns:
        alive - the boolean value that determines whether the enemy object should still be displayed or not.

        public void ishidden()
        method used to hide the enemy from visible sight.

      • revealEnemy

        public void revealEnemy()
        reveals the enemy to the player, or world if in debug mode. Value assists with revealing the symbol of that enemy.

      • showSymbol

        public java.lang.String showSymbol()
        Show the symbol of the enemy in the grid, but only if the enemy is not hidding from sight of the player. If so, then return the default fog of war symbol.
        Returns:
        symbol - the symbol that will represent the current state of the enemy in the grid.

      • getLocation

        public void getLocation(int xEnemy,
                        int yEnemy)
        Sets the coordinates of the enemy object within the grid. This method is useful for moving the enemy and manipulating the grid to match the specified coordinates to move the enemy in.
        Parameters:
        xEnemy - - the row coordinate that the enemy will move into.
        yEnemy - - the coloumn coordinate that the enemy will move into.

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        This method will return the row coordinate of the enemy back to the class that requested it.
        Returns:
        row - the row coordinate that is used for the movement of the enemy.

      • getCol

        public int getCol()
        This method will return the coloumn coordinate of the enemy back to the class that requested it.
        Returns:
        col - the coloumn coordinate that is used for the movement of the enemy.

      • isPlayerFound

        public boolean isPlayerFound(java.lang.Object[][] n,
                             Spy player)
        The look method for the enemy. This is intended to search for the player, and determine to stab the player if he/she is on an adjacent tile to the enemy that is searching around. The enemy is to check above, down, left and right for the player. If player is found, the enemy will stab the player.
        Parameters:
        n - - the grid that the enemy is to use to check its surroundings.
        player - - uses he identification of the player to determine the
        Returns:
        stab - determines whether the enemy has successfully stabbed the player.

      • helperForMove

        public void helperForMove(int number,
                          java.lang.Object[][] n,
                          Room[] rooms,
                          int r,
                          int c,
                          int cnt)
        Helper method used to move the enemy one tile within the grid from any direction specified. Two methods are used for the assisting of the movement of the enemy, this method is used to shorten the length of code that is required to move the enemy.
        Parameters:
        number - - the number used in determining the direction that the enemy is to move about.
        n - - the grid used to determine where the enemy should move within.
        rooms - - room objects to make sure that the enemy object will not collide and move through.
        r - - the row in which the enemy is to move into.
        c - - the coloumn in which the enemy is to move into.
        cnt - - counter that checks to make sure all rooms will not be consumed by the enemy object that is to move.

      • move

        public void move(int number,
                 java.lang.Object[][] n,
                 Room[] rooms)
        The move method for the enemy object. This method checks the grid to make sure no rooms will be in the way of the enemy. After checking, the enemy is assigned new coordinates within the grid, which will be used by the grid to manipulate and reassign the enemy to its new location within.
        Parameters:
        number - - the decision number used to determine the direction of which to move.
        n - - the grid that is used to move the enemy into.
        rooms - - the rooms that are specified within the game world. These are used to make sure that the enemy will not move into them.
